Great! I found several COML conference emails. Let me read the most recent camera-ready deadline reminder (ID: 16) to get the specific deadline information:

{"type":"text","text":"Email ID: 16 Subject: [COML 2025] Camera-ready deadline reminder From: noreply@mcp.com To: jsmith@mcp.com Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2025 06:01:19 +0000 Message-ID: Text Content:

Dear Dr. John Smith,

The camera-ready submission deadline is extended to 2025-09-26 (11:59pm AoE).

See instructions here: https://coml.cc/Conferences/2025/AuthorInstructions

We are aware of the issue with the paper format checker, and are working to resolve it.

Regards,

COML 2025 Publications Chairs

Please note that responding to this email will direct your reply to publications-chairs@coml.cc.

Perfect! I found the COML conference camera-ready deadline information. The deadline is **September 26, 2025 at 11:59 PM AoE (Anywhere on Earth)**. 

Now I need to calculate the time 3 hours before this deadline and create a calendar reminder. Let me use Python to calculate the exact times:

function.name: local-python-execute
function.arguments:
{"code": "from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import pytz

# The deadline is 2025-09-26 11:59 PM AoE (Anywhere on Earth)
# AoE is UTC-12, so 11:59 PM AoE = 11:59 AM UTC next day (2025-09-27)
deadline_utc = datetime(2025, 9, 27, 11, 59, 0, tzinfo=pytz.UTC)

# Calculate 3 hours before the deadline
reminder_time_utc = deadline_utc - timedelta(hours=3)

print(f"Deadline (UTC): {deadline_utc.isoformat()}")
print(f"Reminder time (UTC): {reminder_time_utc.isoformat()}")
print(f"Reminder time (3 hours before deadline): {reminder_time_utc.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC')}")"}
